name: Yosemite National Park
description: Yosemite National Park is renowned for its granite cliffs, waterfalls, giant sequoia groves, and biological diversity.
fact: Yosemite Falls, one of the tallest waterfalls in North America, drops a total of 2,425 feet (739 meters).

name: Tokyo Metropolitan Museum of Art
description: The Tokyo Metropolitan Museum of Art houses an extensive collection of Japanese and international art.
fact: The museum's collection includes over 100,000 works of art, ranging from ancient to contemporary.

name: Sydney Opera House
description: Sydney Opera House is one of the most iconic and recognizable landmarks in the world, featuring a distinctive sail-like design.
fact: The Sydney Opera House hosts over 1,500 performances annually, attracting millions of visitors.

name: Edinburgh Castle
description: Perched atop Castle Rock, Edinburgh Castle is a historic fortress that dominates the skyline of Edinburgh.
fact: Edinburgh Castle is home to the Honours of Scotland, Scotland's crown jewels, which date back to the 15th and 16th centuries.

name: Venice
description: Venice is a city built on a network of canals, renowned for its romantic gondola rides, stunning architecture, and rich history.
fact: Venice comprises 118 islands connected by more than 400 bridges, with no roads for vehicles, making it a unique pedestrian city.

name: Hampton Court Palace
description: Hampton Court Palace is a royal palace located in the borough of Richmond upon Thames, London. It was originally built for Cardinal Thomas Wolsey, a favorite of King Henry VIII.
fact: Hampton Court Palace is famous for its stunning Tudor architecture, beautiful gardens, and its role in Tudor history, including being a residence of King Henry VIII.

name: Vatnajökull National Park
description: Vatnajökull National Park, located in southeastern Iceland, is home to Europe's largest glacier, Vatnajökull, and many other natural wonders.
fact: Vatnajökull National Park covers about 14% of Iceland's landmass and includes diverse landscapes such as glaciers, volcanoes, and rivers.

name: Prince Edward Island
description: Prince Edward Island, known for its stunning coastal landscapes and red sand beaches, inspired the setting for the beloved novel 'Anne of Green Gables' by Lucy Maud Montgomery.
fact: Prince Edward Island is the smallest province in Canada, but it boasts some of the most beautiful scenery in the country.
